intro: Pluchea petiolata, commonly known as slenderleaf groundcherry, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, often surrounded by bracts, while the fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release seeds. Pluchea petiolata is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and along stream banks.
